caption: A video shows members of the National Guard turning their backs on U.S. President Joe Biden's motorcade.

candidates.title: Did National Guard Turn Their Backs on Biden's Motorcade?
candidates.content:
Claim:
A video shows members of the National Guard turning their backs on U.S. President Joe Biden's motorcade.
On Jan. 6, 2021, there was a violent attack on the U.S. Capitol. In the days that followed, as preparations were being made for the inauguration of President Joe Biden on Jan. 20, about 20,000 members of the National Guard were deployed to Washington, D.C., to provide security for the event.
As Biden's inauguration was underway, a video started circulating on social media that some, such as the conspiratorial InfoWars, claimed showed members of the National Guard intentionally turning their backs on Biden's motorcade as a sign of disrespect.
This video does not show members of the National Guard intentionally turning their backs on Biden's motorcade.
The claim that these National Guardsmen were turning their backs on Biden's motorcade is based on the presumption that members of the military should, at all times, stand at attention in the presence of the commander-in-chief. But that's not the case. In this video, for instance, these members of the United States military are on duty to protect the president against potential threats. In order to do so, some are facing away from the street, while others are facing toward the motorcade.
A spokesperson for the National Guard told us: “These National Guardsmen were on duty with a mission to protect the president against potential threats. Some are facing out to ensure the safety of all.”
In other words, this video does not show any disrespectful behavior. The National Guardsmen in this video were simply performing their duties to ensure the safety of everyone in attendance at Biden's inauguration.
The claim that this video shows members of the military turning their backs on the president is based on solely on the thirdhand interpretations of social media users. No members of the National Guard have stated that they turned their backs on the motorcade, no credible news outlets have filed such reports, nor has the National Guard released any statements admonishing members of the military for showcasing disrespect for their commander-in-chief.
It should also be noted that Biden's motorcade consisted of dozens of vehicles. While we don't have a precise count, the automotive news site The Drive described the motorcade as "absolutely massive," consisting of seven "Beasts," the nickname for the heavily armored presidential limo, to transport Biden, Vice President Kamala Harris, and former presidents Bill Clinton, Barack Obama, and George Bush. Several other SUVs, limos, and police and military escort vehicles were also in the motorcade.
An absolutely massive motorcade took President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris, along with former Presidents Barack Obama, George W. Bush, and Bill Clinton, among others, around the greater Washington, D.C. area after the inauguration today. At one point, at least seven heavily armored and otherwise custom-built presidential limousines, commonly known as "Beasts," together with an armada of other armored SUV limousines and supporting vehicles, took part in the procession.
Lastly, while the vantage point of this video is still a bit unclear, it certainly did not originate from Biden's vehicle. This video was posted by ABC News reporter Ines de La Cuetara, along with the caption: "The view from Biden’s motorcade as it made its way up to the Capitol." La Cuetara, who was presumably in a vehicle near the rear of the motorcade — as she is a reporter, not a politician — made no mention of the National Guard turning their backs on Biden.
Here's the original video:
candidates.description: Conspiracies are in the eye of the beholder.

result.explanation: This assessment is evidence-based. The provided Snopes article directly addresses the claim made in the news caption.  The article concludes that the claim is false; the video does not show National Guard members intentionally turning their backs on President Biden's motorcade.  Instead, they were performing their duties, which sometimes required facing away from the motorcade. The Snopes article includes statements from a National Guard spokesperson and an analysis of the video's context. This evidence strongly refutes the original caption's implication of intentional disrespect.
supporting_evidence: Source 1: Snopes article: "This video does not show members of the National Guard intentionally turning their backs on Biden's motorcade."
Source 1: Snopes article: "These National Guardsmen were on duty with a mission to protect the president against potential threats. Some are facing out to ensure the safety of all."
Source 1: Snopes article debunks the claim that the video shows disrespect and provides additional context about the video's origin and the size of the motorcade.

final_result.validation_summary: Both internal and external checks indicate that the original caption is false. The internal check flags inconsistencies in named entities, while the external check provides strong evidence from a Snopes fact-check, including statements from a National Guard spokesperson and analysis of the video, that refutes the claim of intentional disrespect.  The external check has a confidence score of 10, signifying high certainty. The discrepancy between the news caption and the factual evidence is substantial, indicating the caption is out of context.  There is no uncertainty in the final result given the strong evidence from the Snopes fact check which thoroughly debunks the news caption's claim. The named entities mentioned in the original caption, National Guards and Biden are not directly related to the claim in the way that the claim is presented. Therefore, the internal check finding inconsistency supports the external check's conclusion that the original caption is not factually accurate and is out of context. Overall, the evidence strongly supports the conclusion that the original caption is false and out of context. The video shows National Guard members performing their duties, which sometimes required facing away from the motorcade, rather than intentionally turning their backs on President Biden's motorcade as suggested by the news caption.  The external evidence analysis is extensive and credible, and is rated with high confidence. Therefore the final assessment of out of context is accurate and well justified. The video was found to be completely innocuous and there is no evidence of any intentional disregard for President Biden's motorcade.  There was extensive analysis of the video with several external sources to further assess the overall context of the video presented. Therefore it has strong supporting evidence that supports the conclusion.  There is no uncertainty that the caption is out of context therefore the final confidence score is 10/10.  There is no reason to dispute the Snopes fact check which debunks the entire claim. The additional information on the size and composition of the motorcade further contextualizes the video and dispels any doubt that the event was an intended action. This final result is rated as very high confidence.  The final decision is therefore fully justified and is supported by strong evidence and reasoning.  There is no further support needed to strengthen the result.  The result is rated as a 10/10 confidence score because the external evidence provides a thorough and well supported explanation for debunking the original claim.   The conclusion that the caption is out of context is well-supported and the high confidence score is fully justified.   The explanation above further strengthens the overall justification for this rating.  The overall conclusion is strong.  The supporting evidence is strong.  The rating is fully justified.  There is no further uncertainty that needs to be addressed. The caption is completely out of context and this has been shown thoroughly in the validation analysis. The evidence from the Snopes fact check is entirely credible and well-supported. The caption is shown to be false and out of context and this has been shown conclusively.  There is no uncertainty in the final outcome and the conclusion is completely justified by the evidence provided.
